cluster_classes.class_description: Processes and structures involved in the sexual reproduction of flowering plants, including pollination, flowers, pollen, and the plants that bear them.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Butterflies transfer pollen between flowers during pollination, helping plants reproduce via flowers, nectar, and pollen.

members.entity_description: Biological process in which pollen is transferred between flowers, often by organisms, enabling plant reproduction and helping maintain plant populations.
Reproductive structures of plants that produce nectar and pollen visited by butterflies.
Plant reproductive grains carried by butterflies between flowers during pollination.
Organisms that produce flowers, nectar, and pollen and depend on pollination to reproduce.

cluster_classes.class_description: Biological process where butterflies produce offspring to continue their species' life cycle.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Throughout their adult stage, butterflies focus on finding a mate and reproducing to continue the life cycle.

members.entity_description: Biological process where butterflies produce offspring to continue their speciesâ€™ life cycle.

splits.name: Pollination in flowering plants
splits.description: The biological process in which pollen is transferred between flowers (often by animals) to enable sexual reproduction in flowering plants.

args.justification: ClsR_1e9d0076 currently mixes a reproductive process (pollination) with reproductive structures and organisms; splitting out the process yields clearer process vs structure classes.

args.new_name: Flowering plant reproductive structures and organisms
args.new_description: Structures and organisms involved in the sexual reproduction of flowering plants, including flowers, pollen, and the flowering plants that bear them.
args.justification: After splitting out the pollination process, the remaining members in ClsR_1e9d0076 are all structures/organisms; renaming and aligning the class_group to a shared biological reproduction domain makes its scope explicit and connects it to related reproduction classes.

args.new_description: Pollination as a reproductive process in flowering plants, in which pollen is transferred between flowers by wind, animals, or other vectors, enabling fertilization and seed production.
args.justification: The new split class cleanly represents the reproductive process aspect; giving it a precise label and the same biological reproduction class_group as other reproduction-focused classes improves schema coherence.

ClsR_2a20cb5a describes butterfly reproduction, a biological reproduction process; aligning its class_group with the plant reproduction process group creates a unified higher-level group for animal and plant reproduction processes.

executed_decisions.justification: ClsR_1e9d0076 currently mixes a reproductive process (pollination) with reproductive structures and organisms; splitting out the process yields clearer process vs structure classes.

executed_decisions.new_name: Flowering plant reproductive structures and organisms
executed_decisions.new_description: Structures and organisms involved in the sexual reproduction of flowering plants, including flowers, pollen, and the flowering plants that bear them.
executed_decisions.justification: After splitting out the pollination process, the remaining members in ClsR_1e9d0076 are all structures/organisms; renaming and aligning the class_group to a shared biological reproduction domain makes its scope explicit and connects it to related reproduction classes.

executed_decisions.new_description: Pollination as a reproductive process in flowering plants, in which pollen is transferred between flowers by wind, animals, or other vectors, enabling fertilization and seed production.
executed_decisions.justification: The new split class cleanly represents the reproductive process aspect; giving it a precise label and the same biological reproduction class_group as other reproduction-focused classes improves schema coherence.
